title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Department of Meteorology says showers or thundershowers will occur in most parts of the island after 1.00 p.m. today (22).

title: Pope died of a stroke and heart failure, Vatican says
byline: Pope Francis died Monday morning from complications stemming from a stroke that caused coma and irreversible heart failure, the Vatican confirmed in an official statement, AFP reported.

title: Delta plane catches fire at Orlando airport, forcing passenger evacuations
byline: A Delta Air Lines airplane caught fire on Monday before it was supposed to take off at a central Florida airport, forcing the evacuation of passengers, airport officials said.

title: Police urge public to disregard ‘fake letter’ circulating online
byline: Sri Lanka Police have issued a clarification regarding a forged letter circulating on social media, warning that the document is erroneous in its entirety and intended to mislead the public and also to tarnish the reputation of the Police Department.

title: Legal action taken against 4,000 motorists using CCTV footage in Colombo
byline: Legal action has been taken against more than 4,000 motorists based on footage obtained from CCTV cameras installed with the Colombo city, according to Police.

title: Special postal voting center for police officers on duty at ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’
byline: Preparations have been made to establish a special postal voting center in Kandy for police officers on duty at the ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’, exposition at the Temple of the Tooth Relic in Kandy, the Commissioner General of Elections Saman Sri Ratnayake said.

title: Guidelines issued for devotees attending ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’
byline: A set of health and safety guidelines for the protection of devotees participating in the ongoing ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’ exposition at the Temple of the Tooth Relic in Kandy has been issued by the Health Promotion Bureau (HPB).

title: Who is Cardinal Kevin Farrell, the acting head of the Vatican?
byline: When the world learned of Pope Francis’ death on Monday morning, an Irish-American cardinal, little known in the wider world, was the one to break the news.

title: AG seeks 3-judge bench to hear case against Keheliya
byline: The Attorney General has requested the Chief Justice to appoint a Trial-at-Bar with a three-judge bench to hear the case filed in relation to the alleged importation of substandard human immunoglobulin vials.

title: Constitutional Council to convene today to decide on new Auditor General
byline: The Constitutional Council is scheduled to convene today (22 April) to decide on the appointment of the new Auditor General.

title: Indian actor Mahesh Babu summoned by ED in money laundering case
byline: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned Telugu actor Mahesh Babu in connection with a money laundering probe into Hyderabad-based real estate firms, news agency PTI reported on Tuesday.

title: ‘Obata Geyak – Ratata Hetak’: Govt. increases housing aid for low-income families
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to increase the financial assistance provided for a housing unit under the “Obata Geyak – Ratata Hetak” housing program, which is aimed at addressing the housing needs of low-income and impoverished families.

title: Sri Lanka records over 846,000 tourist arrivals in April
byline: A total of 846,221 tourists have arrived in the country as of April 20, 2025, the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) has announced.

title: Special announcement for ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’ attendees
byline: A request has been made from devotees attending the special exposition, ‘Siri Dalada Wandanawa’, at the Temple of the Tooth Relic in Kandy.

title: Election merely another attempt to gain power for opposition - PM
byline: While the opposition views the upcoming Local Government (LG) election as just another attempt to gain power, for the government, it is an opportunity to ensure that the allocations of public funds will reach rural communities without corruption, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has stated.

title: Shooting incident reported in Katunayake; One suspect arrested
byline: A shooting incident has been reported in Andiambalama, Katunayake.

title: Cabinet nod for new Commissioner General of Motor Traffic
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved a proposal to appoint Kamal Amarasinghe, a Special Grade Officer of the Sri Lanka Administrative Service (SLAS), as the new Commissioner General of Motor Traffic.

title: Instagram tries using AI to determine if teens are pretending to be adults
byline: Instagram is beginning to test the use of artificial intelligence to determine if kids are lying about their ages on the app, parent company Meta Platforms said on Monday.

title: Committee appointed to study Presidential Commission Report on Easter Sunday attacks
byline: A four-member committee, headed by a Senior Deputy Inspector General of Police (Senior DIG), has been appointed to study and investigate the findings of the Presidential Commission Report on the Easter Sunday attacks, said the Police Spokesman.

title: Committee appointed to study Presidential Commission report on Easter attacks
byline: A four-member committee has been appointed to study the report of the Presidential Commission of Inquiry into the 2019 Easter Sunday attacks.

title: Vatican releases first images of Pope Francis in open coffin
byline: The Vatican on Tuesday published the first photo and video of Pope Francis lying in repose, showing the late pontiff in an open coffin dressed in red liturgical vestments, a mitre on his head and a rosary placed in his hands.

title: Pope’s funeral on Saturday, Vatican confirms
byline: The funeral of Pope Francis will be held on Saturday, 27 April, the Vatican has announced.

title: Who will be named in committee to probe Deshabandu Tennakoon?
byline: The Speaker of Parliament has informed the Prime Minister and the Leader of Opposition to nominate names for the committee to be appointed to investigate allegations of misconduct and abuse of power against Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon.

title: Court orders release of 2 arrested on suspicion during Easter Sunday service
byline: The Colombo Magistrate’s Court has ordered the release of a man and a woman who were arrested on suspicion during the Easter Sunday service at St. Anthony’s Church in Kochchikade.

title: Gambling Sports Regularization draft bill to be gazetted
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval to publish the draft bill of Gambling Sports Regularization Act in the government gazette and to present in Parliament for approval.

title: Advisory for severe lightning in several provinces
byline: The Department of Meteorology has issued an advisory for severe lightning in several provinces and districts today.

title: South Korea’s contributions to youth development in Sri Lanka commended
byline: South Korea has played a key role in equipping young Sri Lankans with vocational skills and language proficiency, says Deputy Minister of Defence Major General Aruna Jayasekara (Retd).

title: Health Minister assures country has sufficient insulin stocks
byline: The government has already distributed sufficient insulin stocks for the next four months, Minister of Health Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa has stated.
